summary: This bill, the Enhanced Iran Sanctions Act of 2025, aims to strengthen sanctions against entities involved in the processing, export, or sale of Iranian oil, gas, and petrochemicals. It mandates sanctions on foreign persons, including financial institutions, involved in these activities. The President can impose property blocking, visa restrictions, and other measures. It also establishes an Interagency Working Group on Iranian Sanctions and encourages the creation of a multilateral contact group to coordinate international enforcement efforts. The bill includes exceptions for humanitarian aid, international obligations, and safety of vessels, and allows for waivers. It also amends existing legislation to encourage private sector reporting on sanctions violations.
